title:
Scale invariance and the Diophantine approximation in the Bloch vector
  of the thermal multi-photon Jaynes-Cummings model
abstract:
In this paper, we study the time evolution of the Bloch vector of the thermal
multi-photon Jaynes-Cummings model (JCM) and discuss the following two facts.
First, we consider a plot that consists of points of a trajectory of the Bloch
vector of the multi-photon JCM for a discrete-time sequence with a constant
time interval. We show that this plot is invariant under a scale transformation
of the finite but not zero interval of the time. Second, we numerically
evaluate values of the time when the absolute value of the $z$-component of the
Bloch vector is nearly equal to zero. We demonstrate that some values of the
time can be derived with denominators of fractions of the Diophantine
approximation for irrational numbers. The origin of those phenomena is that the
components of the Bloch vector for thermal multi-photon JCM cannot be described
with the Fourier series.
